node.accessibility_caption: Photo by CNA on May 31, 2020. Image may contain: 1 person, text that says 'Michael Jordan: I stand with those calling out racism & violence toward people of colour'

node.text: What is happening in the USA is because they have a 💩President who does not care for his citizens & a racist too.

Basketball great Michael Jordan voiced outrage on Sunday (May 31) over the death of George Floyd, an incident that has triggered violent nationwide protests in the United States.

Jordan said his heart went out to the family of Floyd and others who have died through acts of racism. "I am deeply saddened, truly pained and plain angry," Jordan, a Basketball Hall of Famer and owner of the National Basketball Association's Charlotte Hornets, said in a statement.

He continued: "I see and feel everyone's pain, outrage and frustration. I stand with those who are calling out the ingrained racism and violence toward people of colour in our country. We have had enough." Jordan, a six-time NBA champion who was at the heart of the Chicago Bulls' dynasty in the 1990s, also called on people to show compassion and empathy and never turn their backs on senseless brutality.

He said: “We need to continue peaceful expressions against injustice and demand accountability. Our unified voice needs to put pressure on our leaders to change our laws, or else we need to use our vote to create systemic change. Every one of us needs to be part of the solution, and we must work together to ensure justice for all.” #MichaelJordan #GeorgeFloyd (Photo: Screengrab from The Last Dance)
Whatever ur colour is ur true heart be humble in life.
@mallivee u do know that... many African-Americans.... are Born in America right... they arent immigrants........
@mallivee 😂😂 OMG you’re so stupid that it’s funny

Well!! U came to the US to earn a living & if u r not happy can always return to ur original country instead of expecting to go ur way. I totally agree what the police officers did was absolutely wrong!

Let's first not be naive that racism does not exist, and can be inculturated even. That said, the issue is about police brutality towards those in custody. (Let's not forget about one minor who was left in a cold aircon room in our own police custody and that was just reprimanded by the judge.) But looting and burning other people's property has now taken over and blindsided the real issue. As for those who think racism doesn't exist even in this country, you are so naive.

This is why I am thankful that the Singapore government values racial and religious harmony since independence and adopted a zero-tolerance stance for those who tries to sow discord between the different races. It is laws like the Maintenance of the Religious Harmony Act in Singapore that safeguards our rights and prevents outright discrimination against another race/religion (though we know casual racism exist and we definitely can do better as a society).

@funnybunnytan_2 no one fucking chooses to be born a certain race my dude how dense and ignorant can u be.. theyre born black to learn WHAT lesson? stfu bro Black people are being ruthlessly murdered and don't even have the right to exist and breathe, this isn't some CCE lesson, REAL LIVES ARE BEING LOST

If you choose to be born black, relax and take it easy
Don’t blame others around you, you’re born black to learn a certain lesson

In Singapore, it is a blessing that we have laws to deal with any political parties that try to win elections by using race and religion to divide and rule or in fact any person for that matter. It is the fastest and most lethal way to destroy a country. Singaporeans by and large are tolerant through the many decades of education, through our wise leaders who implemented the just rules of the land where meritocracy, regardless of race or religion was being pledged into our moral veins at a very tender age. There can be no peace and prosperity when divisions abound in families, or in corporations and the country. All eyes can see what has happened to Hong Kong a land of peace, freedom and prosperity turned into a 1nightmare by the hands whose agenda is destroy Hong Kong. Many other nations suffered the same and now USA. Hope that Singaporeans remain vigilant in guarding our little island from evil hands and hearts.
What is happening in the USA is because they have a 💩President who does not care for his citizens & a racist too.
